section.marginalnote: Limits or conditions on services and restricted activities

subsection.subsectiontext: A registrant may prescribe, dispense or administer topically a therapeutic pharmaceutical agent only if the registrant has successfully completed a certification program established, required or approved under the bylaws to ensure that registrants are qualified and competent to perform those restricted activities.
A registrant must notify a patient's treating physician, if known to the registrant, on prescribing, dispensing or administering a therapeutic pharmaceutical agent for or to the patient.
A registrant must provide to the named individual, free of charge, a legible written or electronic copy of

paragraph.paragraphtext: the prescription for a corrective eyeglass lens, on completion of the eye examination, and
the contact lens record, on completion of the fitting.

subsection.subsectiontext: In a prescription for a corrective eyeglass lens, a registrant

paragraph.paragraphtext: must not, in any manner, express or imply that only a registrant or qualified medical practitioner, or a person acting under delegation from or supervision of a registrant or qualified medical practitioner, is authorized or qualified to dispense a corrective eyeglass lens using information contained in the prescription,
must inform the named individual that the prescription is not a prescription for a contact lens,
must, unless a specific contraindication for the wearing of contact lenses by the named individual is set out in the prescription, inform the named individual that

subparagraph.subparagraphtext: a contact lens may be fitted and dispensed using information contained in the prescription, and

only a registrant, qualified medical practitioner or contact lens fitter, or a person acting under delegation from or supervision of a registrant, qualified medical practitioner or contact lens fitter, is authorized to fit a contact lens, and

paragraph.paragraphtext: must advise the named individual to return to a registrant or qualified medical practitioner if the individual experiences any persistent physiological problems with a corrective eyeglass lens or contact lens that has been dispensed using information contained in the prescription.
